page.title: 13UPTON VILLAGE
page.content:
We talked to the ladies in the village shop who said that the post office had not always been where it now is, it had moved from house to house and had been in three different houses in the village in the last twenty five years, moving to its present place ten years ago. It is not even marked correctly on the current ordanance survey maps!
The shop is open in the mornings only in the week until 1.00 and for an hour or two on Sunday mornings for people to buy papers. The shop sells many things from fruit to shoelaces. Bread and milk are delivered only twice a week so you need to know which days you can buy it! (A can of orange drink costs 18p, very reasonable for a rural village shop).
